Author: Deleted User#0000
Content:
ok, new server ordered, just finished the global process handling T TX. Figured out that with the only little checkboxes that will provide anon on demand, there is much more cases than just a : paying in Z ? ok gen a Z.
It affects how funds , via addresses, must be distributed across servers, to allow scaling for Z.
(of course mixmatch of servers are possible, a server can be eligible for Z only, or serve both and be included i the randomization process)
As it s currently designed : T stays on coinserver classic, or on any available T server, if it s a z, same : Generate the address on any avail Z server 

The only edge case is that if one side want to be paid in Z, and the other side pays in T. That would have needed an additional process, but not anymore as the server choosing catch this case and gen the T address for the dst on a Z server, allowing to direclty sending back to the src his share

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: this will aboid 1 very intensive step, cause if that would have not distributed like it, even T servers could end up handling Z tx

Author: Deleted User#0000
Content: judging about performance and Z rate / percentage of usage, admins will be able to add servers in minutes, without disturbing the app

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: `komodo-cli clearwalletnotarisations <txid> ` deletes all txs except the one specified ... wallet.dat does not actually decrease in size ... but the listuapent call speeds up as if it did... not sure why.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the walelt is as stupid as we always thaught it was ... it stores everythig as a TX

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and you can only delete a tx

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: or add it

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: so if a tx is received by you, and only 1 of 1000 vouts is yours

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: it stores the whole thing

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: seems best way is to detect balance with unspent balance... then remove all txs with no unspent balance

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I did that with my filter algo, but only for notarisations
